settings.title: Individuals with a spirit for adventure.
settings.text: Our ambassadors exemplify what it means to live and breathe adventure. They push boundaries and test limitations in the most remote parts of the world. Often providing Grayl valuable knowledge and experience to better our products and our brand. They are gracious stewards of our planet and inspire our growth and development.

settings.code:
CONSERVATIONIST, TOUR LEADER/OPERATOR

CHRIS LININGER

After discovering long ago that his natural habitat is in the mountains, Chris decided to pursue his mud and snow-covered path as a long-distance hiker, photographer, conservationist, and adventure tour operator at Epic Backpacker Tours; a small adventure tour company offering trips to off the beaten path destinations. Currently, Chris spends a majority of the year traveling and leading trips in the Karakoram range in Pakistan, at the threat of overdosing on rice, roti, and sweet chai. When he is not on the road (and most of the time when he is), Chris is a contributor for Grayl.

@off_the_atlas

settings.text:
Every time Jackson embarks on a world adventure he collects one bag full of trash. Itâs his small way of saying thanks to mother nature. He's traveled the world taking beautiful photographs and cleaning up the place. He's the founder of Adventure Bag CrewÂ a movement to empower people to make a small effort and pick up a bag of trash while they explore the natural world. We see Jackson as a leader inspiring youth to have a heart for the planet and make sustainable choices that guide their life decisions.

To date, Conservation Alliance grants have saved more than 73 million acres of wildlands across the United States.Â

settings.subtitle: PARTNER
settings.title: Helping the Helpers
settings.text: All Hands and Hearts addresses the immediate and long-term needs of global communities impacted by natural disasters. The organization works directly with local leaders and community members and deploys volunteers to enable direct impact, helping to build safer, more resilient schools, homes and infrastructure. Graylâs donations fund âWaSHâ programsâwater, sanitation, and hygieneâto create disaster-resilient access to clean water for local communities.

settings.subtitle: PARTNER
settings.title: Access to Clean Water
settings.text: Charity: water is an organization that brings clean, safe drinking water to communities in developing countries by building sustainable, community-owned water projects around the world. This year, GraylÂ isÂ sponsoringÂ the rehabilitation of a well for a communityÂ in Malawi, one of Africaâs most densely populated and least developed countries. The projectÂ will provide access to safe drinking water for an entire community in Malawi, drastically reducing the risk of water-related diseases and giving time back to women and children.

settings.subtitle: PARTNER
settings.title: Protecting Where We Love to Travel
settings.text: The Adventure Travel Conservation Fund directly funds local projects engaged in the conservation of unique natural and cultural resources in the most treasured destinations outside of North America. Graylâs contributions help fund projects that protect threatened communities, cultures and wild places throughout the world.Â

settings.subtitle: PARTNER
settings.title: Impact Close to Home
settings.text: Since 1979, Washington Wild has played an invaluable role in permanently protecting nearly three million acres of Wilderness throughout Washington, our home state. They bring people together in the vigorous defense of our remaining wild forests, waters, and wildlife. By educating, empowering and mobilizing our communities, Washington Wild builds powerful grassroots networks that help protect wild lands and waters throughout the state.

settings.subtitle: PARTNER
settings.title: Experiential Education for Inner City Youth
settings.text: Soul River unites inner city youth and veterans on challenging, yet rewarding adventures at zero cost. They become part of something bigger than themselves, developing into strong leaders in the outdoors and their communities.

settings.subtitle: PARTNER
settings.title: Black Leadership in the Outdoors.
settings.text: Outdoor Afro celebrates and inspires Black connections and leadership in nature. With networks in 46 cities led by 102 volunteer leaders, the organization helps people take better care of themselves, their communities, and the planet through outdoor recreation. Grayl's support goes in part to help fund Outdoor Afro's Making Waves Swim Initiative that provides access to the lifesaving, nature-embracing skill of swimming.Â

settings.title: OUR STORY
settings.subheading: We live for global travel and outdoor adventure.

settings.title: Wise adventurers arenât reckless.
settings.text: We’ve spent hundreds of nights in tents in the backcountry and thousands of days in the developing world. We’ve worked, played and lived in places where having access to safe, clean water is a necessity. Whether on the trail needing to drink from a dirty stream, filling up at a questionable hotel sink in Peru, or being prepared for an emergency.

settings.title: We empower adventure.
settings.text: Clean, safe water is a fundamental element of life and key ingredient of any adventure. GRAYL empowers travelers and adventurers with products that drive self-sufficiency and safe passage, wherever they go.

settings.title: Bar napkin sketch to Kickstarter.
settings.text: From a napkin sketch in a hometown Seattle bar to a growing obsession to make the perfect purifier. Our first Kickstarter raised over $250,000 from travelers and adventurers from all corners of the globe.

settings.title: Better in every way.
settings.text: We set out to revolutionize portable purification and in the process designed the most versatile, fastest, and easy to use  purifier in the world. So anyone could tap into and safely drink from sketchy spigots, hotel sinks, murky rivers, wells, or lakes.

settings.title: Giving back is essential.
settings.text: GRAYL cares deeply about the planet and we put our money where our mouth is. We donate a minimum of 1% from every sale to environmental charities and non-profits.

settings.subheading: GLOBAL PROTECTION. CHEMICAL-FREE TECHNOLOGY. EFFORTLESS FUNCTION.

settings.text: Waterborne viruses are found in all developing countries,Â infectingÂ travelers and local populations âÂ killing hundreds of thousands of children annually.Â Designed for use anywhere on earth, GRAYL purifiersÂ provideÂ global protection from all waterborne pathogens plus chemicals, heavy metals, and even microplastics.

GEOPRESS provides a user experience that is second to none. Unrivaled in speed, ease, and versatility — it's effective on all 7 continents and provides complete protection from all waterborne pathogens (virus, bacteria, protozoan cysts) plus chemicals, pesticides, heavy metals, and even microplastics.

At the end of a purifier cartridgeâs life, youÂ will be ableÂ to send back expended cartridges in a mailer to Grayl. settings.title: CRISIS EQUIPPED.
settings.subheading: PREPARING FOR AN EMERGENCY? GRAB YOUR GRAYL.

settings.code:
"Have a plan, be prepared, and make h2o a priority for your emergency kit."

Clean water is a basic need. During an emergency, access to safe drinking water often becomes impossibly scarce. GraylÂ® purifier bottles empower anyone, anywhere, to quickly make a supply of safe, clean filtered drinking water. Pick up a Grayl and be prepared for natural disasters like floods, wildfires, tornadoes, hurricanes, winter storms, and earthquakes. #purifywateranywhere

FILL.

Fill at your sink. That's it. No need to pre-boil your water when using a Grayl Purifier.


PRESS.

Press on a low surface. This could be your wood or carpet floor in your home or a flat surfaced stool. The lower the better. Press using the force of you body weight.


DRINK.

Your water is now free of virus and bacteria and completely safe to drink. You can also use your Grayl multiple times and fill up pitchers or containers for storage.

Can Grayl Purifiers be used during 'Boil Water Advisory'?

Yes. A âBoil Water Advisoryâ comes into effect when municipal water systems that supply a cityâs or townâs water supply becomes contaminated with pathogens that could make you sick. Grayl purifiers remove all types of waterborne pathogens.

Do Grayl Purifiers remove Cryptosporidium and Giardia?

Yes. Grayl purifiers remove all types of waterborne pathogens,, including Rotavirus, Hepatitis A, Norovirus, Giardiasis, Cryptosporidium, E. Coli, Cholera, Salmonella, Dysentery, amoebas, and more.

Where Can You Find Water in Emergencies?

If your water supply becomes limited, there are sources of water you can access in your home.

  • Water from your water heater. This is the tank that connects to your tap, faucets and showerheads, not radiant heating.
  • Melted ice in your freezer.
  • Water from the toilet tank (not the bowl), as long as it has not been chemically treated.
  • Pool water, if untreated can be used for washing and running your toilet. In a pinch, you can also use your Grayl to purify pool water. Be sure to strain out debris using a handkerchief or t-shirt before purifying.

Donât forget sources from outside your home (must all be purified with Grayl before drinking):

  • Collected rainwater.
  • Melted ice in your freezer.
  • Snowmelt.
  • Nearby streams or rivers.

settings.text: You're in the right place to quickly get adventure ready with your Grayl UltraPressÂ® Titanium Bottle.

settings.title: GUIDE TO FIRST USE
settings.text: The most versatile water purifier ever dreamt, let alone built! The world's first titanium filter bottle provides unparalleled strength to weight ratio and meets the most challenging rigors of the outdoors. Itâs drink-mix ready (hello electrolytes) and the Outer Ti Cup can be used to heat water and cook food near a fire or on a camp stove.

settings.subtitle: pull apart with ease
settings.text: Grasp the FlipCarryÂ® Handle with one hand and the Outer Ti Cup with the other, then pull apart. A quick twist helps to initiate separation.

settings.subtitle: FILL WITH DIRTY WATER
settings.text: Scoop from a stream or lake, or fill from any bathroom sink or rustic hostel tap.

settings.subtitle: VENT THE CAP
settings.text: Twist the SimpleVentÂ® cap a half-turn to allow air to vent during filtration &Â purification process.

settings.subtitle: PRESS TO FILTER & PURIFY
settings.text:
Twist the SimpleVentÂ® cap 1/2 turn to allow air to vent during purification process. Utilizing your body weight, press with steady downward force.

Fast and easy; makes clean drinking water in 10 seconds - anywhere!

NOTE: Actual "press time" will vary depending on water quality, cartridge lifespan, water temperature, and user ability.

settings.subtitle: ON FIRE
settings.text:
Use your multi-purpose UltraPressÂ® Outer Ti Cup to heat water and cook food alongside hot coals or near a direct flame. Always utilize the butterfly handles around heat and adequately protect your hands with leather or heat-safe gloves or tools.

WARNING: Titanium will burn your hands when hot! Handle with extreme caution and always use a set of tongs, improvised tool (aka stick), and/or leather gloves when handling hot metal.

settings.subtitle: ON CAMP STOVE
settings.text:
Use with a backpacking stove to boil water for meals or hot beverages. The Outer Ti Cup can be heated to very hot temperatures. Use handles when placing or removing from camp stove.

WARNING: Titanium (including the handles) will burn your hands when hot! Remove from camp stove with caution and use leather heat-safe gloves or other suitable protection. Never directly touch a hot Outer Ti Cup and only use with stoves that have a small platform and level supported base.

settings.subtitle: filling from above
settings.text: Sometimes getting to the river's edge is not an option. You may be stuck needing water from above, or fishing for a scoop. Tie paracord to the D-Ring on the Outer Ti Cup and drop to fill.

settings.subtitle: CLEANING AND STORING
settings.text:
CLEANING: All components should be washed regularly. Do not put any components into a dishwasher. Do not wash Cartridge with soap or any cleaning agents.

STORING: Perform a "dry press" with your Grayl by pressing without water in the bottle. Pour out excess water and remove cartridge. Remove One-Way Silicone Valve and allow Cartridge to air-dry thoroughly (depending on humidity it will take 2-4 days to completely dry). Hand wash all other parts including One-Way Silicone Valve with warm, soapy water. Reassemble unit to create air tight seal for storage. Cartridges can last up to three years after opening if cared for properly between uses.

settings.subtitle: cartridge removal
settings.text: Locate the Cartridge âlock tabâ at bottom of Inner Press. Then pull out the âlock tabâand unscrew the Cartridge counter-clockwise (lefty loosey) until it separates from the Inner Press.

settings.subtitle: Valve removal
settings.text: You may need to remove your valve to clean and dry it. Firmly pull the valve from it's seated position in the cartridge untill it is free.

settings.subtitle: cartridge install
settings.text: Firmly grasp Inner Press, then insert Cartridge into bottom of Inner Press. Rotate and until cartridge tab locks into place.

settings.subtitle: valve install
settings.text: Press the One-Way Drink Mix Valve until it is firmly seated in the cartridge.

settings.text: The UltraPressÂ® Titanium is durable, lightweight, and easy to carry. It will fit in most hip packs, and slings. Try our BottleLockâ¢ Hip Pack specifically designed for a Grayl.

settings.subtitle: 01 INSTALLATION
settings.text: Using your thumbs firmly press and seat the One-Way Silicone Valve into the cartridge. Insert finger into valve if needed.

settings.subtitle: 02 SEATING & SECURING
settings.text: Protect the cartridge media by double-checking that the valve is seated and secured. Check proper installation visually, by ensuring the rim of the silicone is flush with topside, and that the base of the Valve is flush with Cartridge floor.

settings.subtitle: 03 REMOVAL
settings.text: Using your fingers, firmly pinch the top of the One-Way Silicone Valve, then firmly grasp and remove the Valve from the Cartridge.

settings.subtitle: COMPATIBILITY
settings.text: Only compatible with 2nd Generation cartridges first sold in April 2023 that include a new "core" and "flow channel" design (horizontal vents). 1st Generation cartridges are not compatible with the Drink-Mix Valve.
